page.title: 05FARMING: TITHBY
page.content: Most land here is farmed on the arable system, growing wheat, barley, rape, sugar beet & potatoes. Most cottages are occupied by the farm workers; all have been modernised and are usually rent/rate free. Most farms employ 3 or 4 men. There is a dairy farm at Tithby with a 200 cow milking herd and 1 or 2 others have some sheep & store cattle. Nearly all the land attached to the dairy farm is grass & lucerne which is grazed by cows and young stock, & made into silage for winter feed. The cows are Fresians, cost about Â£800 each & give 6,000 kg of milk per lactation. All the milk is sold through the Milk Marketing Board at 17 p/litre and is collected daily by tanker. Previously cheese was made at this farm but demand outgrew the premises and Tithby Dairy is now based at Bottesford.
